title: Oxfordshire Live: Friday 3 March - BBC News
summary: anger at mismanaged £ 2.8bn great western rail link electrification .
mobile phone death crash driver handed more than three years jail .
oxford united tickets for efl trophy go on sale to season ticket holders .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thanks for reading today , we 'll be back with more news , sport , weather and travel from around oxfordshire from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: mod criticised for crush death
text: the ministry of defence has been criticised after the death of a driver , crushed by a reversing lorry , at their site in southam .

the health and safety executive ( hse ) issued a crown censure , the maximum sanction for a government body , after agency driver graham wood was caught between the lorry and another stationary vehicle at mod kineton .
the mod failed to assess the risks faced by the 55-year-old from bicester , as he delivered goods to a holding area in november 2013 , the hse said .
the censure does n't carry a financial penalty , but is an official record of a failure to meet standards in the law .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cloudy with some further rain
text: after a mostly dry and cloudy afternoon , there 'll be some outbreaks of showery rain later this evening and overnight , with some drier interludes too .
minimum temperature 5c ( 41f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: raf fires pilot over 4,400ft nosedive
text: raf fires pilot over 4,400ft nosedive

documents.title: breakingraf pilot dismissed over 4,400ft nosedive
text: an raf pilot who caused his plane to nosedive while using a digital camera has been dismissed by a court martial .
flt lt andrew townshend cost the ministry of defence millions of pounds when he deactivated the autopilot of the military passenger jet .
the voyager aircraft dived 4,400ft ( 1,341m ) over the black sea on a flight from raf brize norton to afghanistan .
townshend pleaded guilty to negligently performing a duty and was also handed a four-month suspended prison sentence .
author: Joe Nimmo
BBC South

documents.title: new 'super council ' proposals published
text: today the latest proposal for how to reorganise local government for oxfordshire has been published , with the support of the county council , and two of the five district councils .
the joint proposal is called `` a new council for a better oxfordshire '' and sets out a case for abolishing the existing two-tier structure of six councils - replacing them with one single council .
the plans were announced by the leaders of south oxfordshire and vale of white horse district councils , and oxfordshire county council .

documents.title: long signs new one-year contract
text: long signs new one-year contract

documents.title: police numbers set to be halved in wantage , councillor warns
text: the number of bobbies on the beat in wantage could be halved , a top councillor has warned .
author: Oxford Mail

documents.title: catch up with this week 's cinema releases
text: james and david got to talk for the first time since the farcical mix-up at the oscars ceremony .
james has been speaking to james mangold , the director of the latest film in the wolverine series .
our james thinks logan is fantastic - `` the real deal '' when it comes to a superhero movie with a difference , and is more like a western than a traditional comic book adaptation .
james is less of a fan of the new comedy fist fight , which stars charlie day and ice cube .
but james did enjoy viceroy 's house - a period drama starting hugh bonneville and gillingham anderson and set in india during the last days of british rule .
author: Martin Eastaugh
BBC Radio Oxford producer

documents.title: oxfordshire 's big picture
text: oxfordshire 's big picture

documents.title: great western electrification 'mismanaged '
text: the electrification of the great western rail line has been described by mps as a `` stark example of how not to run a major project '' .
the public accounts committee ( pac ) said `` mismanagement '' of the project had left customers `` angry and frustrated '' .
it warns `` similar flaws '' could impact on planned electrification schemes on midlands and transpennine routes .
network rail claimed it had `` learnt lessons '' and major projects no longer start before being `` properly scoped '' .

however , doubts have been expressed that the plan can be delivered by december 2018 and to a budget of £ 2.8bn , while the pac described a £ 1.2bn increase in costs `` in the space of a year '' as `` staggering and unacceptable '' .
author: Sarah Lee
BBC South

documents.title: driver who met victim 's partner jailed
text: driver who met victim 's partner jailed

documents.title: raf pilot to be sentenced over nosedive negligence
text: an raf pilot is to be sentenced at court martial for negligence after he caused a military passenger jet to go into a nosedive .
flight lieutenant andrew townshend 's digital camera became stuck against the flight stick , deactivating the autopilot of his voyager aircraft .
the 49-year-old pleaded guilty to negligently performing a duty in relation to the nikon d5300 dslr camera colliding with the aircraft 's control stick .
the trial heard that the incident took place over the black sea during a flight from raf brize norton to camp bastion in afghanistan on 9 february .

documents.title: breakinga34 crash driver jailed
text: a driver who met the partner of a man he killed in a head-on crash has been jailed for more than three years .
lewis stratford crashed through the central reservation of the a34 at compton , oxfordshire , while arguing with his girlfriend on the phone .
the 24-year-old collided with a bmw driven by gavin roberts , 28 , who died in the crash on 11 june last year .
stratford met his victim 's girlfriend meg williamson after admitting causing death by dangerous driving .
at reading crown court he was sentenced to three years and eight months in jail , and banned from driving for four years and 10 months .

documents.title: a34 death : driver to be sentenced
text: a driver is due to be sentenced today for causing the death of a man on the a34 in berkshire last year .
lewis stratford , 24 , from field avenue , oxford , crashed through the central reservation of the a34 in june and collided with another vehicle .
the other motorist , australian national gavin roberts , 28 , was killed .
he will be sentenced at reading crown court later .
author: Sarah Lee
BBC South

documents.title: the u 's chairman talks to radio oxford
text: oxford united fans are giddy with anticipation of another trip to wembley after getting to the efl trophy final .
radio oxford spoke to the u 's chairman darryl eales about his hopes for the league one play offs and a second trip to wembley .

documents.title: man taken to hospital after two cyclists collide
text: a cyclist , thought to be in his 50s , has been taken to the john radcliffe hospital after a crash on the banbury road .
south central ambulance service was called to the incident , which involved two cyclists , at about 08:00 this morning .
the cyclist is thought to have suffered head injuries , the other cyclist was treated at the scene .
author: Phil Mercer
BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: more than 100 drivers caught using mobiles after stricter punishments came into law
text: day 3 of the new phone penalties !
sadly over 138 drivers have been dealt with for using a handheld phone in @ twitterid in first 2 days # 5996
do they get 6 points and a fine ?
should do .
yes £ 200 & 6pts .
great job , it takes these kind of measures to make people realise that a car is a weapon , and needs your full attention
have there been less rtas in the 3 days ?
it would certainly be an interesting stat to look at over a period of time .
very !
3 days with variable weather probably not the best sample group .
perhaps one month ?
might really help hit home then !
hi - as i have said before you would need to give a statement as well # 8038
i think the money from fines should go straight into the police force .
you need everything you can get right now
ca n't believe with the cost of bluetooth hands free kits around £ 20 , that this still happens !
i 'm not `` sad '' that they have been dealt with , quite the opposite .
deal with more please .
# stampoutphoneuse
@ twitterid @ twitterid 138 potential killers !
keep up the good work
good work guys , keep up the pressure , the message might , just might get across .
@ twitterid @ twitterid keep up the great work .
your efforts should make it safer for everyone ; especially us motorcyclists .
here 's another one for you , caught in marlow yesterday
@ twitterid @ twitterid i wonder how many of them knew about the new penalties ?
should it matter ?
at least they 'll tell people about it now .

documents.title: tickets for oxford united 's efl trophy final go on sale for season ticket holders
text: tickets for the final at wembley will go on sale to the club 's season ticket holders later this morning .
firstly on the club 's website , where all the details are posted , that 's at 11:00 .
then by phone on a dedicated number 0844 453 9015 from 13:00 .
season ticket holders can buy up to six seats each for the final .
general sale will start on 13 march .
author: Robyn Cowen
Presenter, Radio Oxford Sport

documents.title: today 's weather : rain
text: it 's not a great day in terms of weather .
there should be consistent downpours across the county , which will turn into showers later on .
there will be highs of 9c .

documents.title: mobile phone crash death driver due to be sentenced
text: a man who has been convicted of death by dangerous driving is due to be sentenced today .
lewis stratford , 24 , from oxford , crossed the central reservation on the a34 while he was on his mobile phone , having an argument with his girlfriend .
the crash killed gavin roberts , 28 , from australia .
stratford met meg williamson , mr roberts ' girlfriend on inside out south before his sentencing .
ms williamson said : `` the hardest bit originally , i think , was just walking through the door , not knowing how i was going to be feeling , how i was going to react . ''

documents.title: anger at 'mismanaged ' £ 2.8bn rail scheme
text: the electrification of the great western rail line has been described by mps as a `` stark example of how not to run a major project '' .
the public accounts committee ( pac ) said `` mismanagement '' of the project had left customers `` angry and frustrated '' .
it warns `` similar flaws '' could impact on planned electrification schemes on midlands and transpennine routes .
network rail claimed it had `` learnt lessons '' and major projects no longer start before being `` properly scoped '' .

however , doubts have been expressed that the plan can be delivered by december 2018 and to a budget of £ 2.8bn , while the pac described a £ 1.2bn increase in costs `` in the space of a year '' as `` staggering and unacceptable '' .

documents.title: take the national express
text: in the words of neil hannon from the divine comedy : `` take the national express , when your life 's in a mess it 'll make you smile . ''
what 's the context of this ?
there is n't one , but i 've been writing local live introductions for about a year now and they ca n't all be winners .
anyway , whether or not your life is a mess we will make you smile with some news , travel , weather and sport .
do n't forget to share your from across the county with us for this week 's oxfordshire 's big picture .
you can send us your snaps by email .
other coach services are available .
author: Alex Regan
BBC South
